title: Pixel 4XL - Sudden vibrations and ghost touch input
content:
Roughly 2-3 weeks back my Pixel 4XL suddenly started vibrating at random moments several times in a row, almost like multiple message notifications (but no new messages do arrive) or like its having a seizure.

The phone either calms down after a while or stops (sometimes only intermediatly) when locking the screen. A reboot of the screen also stops the behavior.
Additionally to the vibrations it is like a "ghost user" is touching on the screen, i.e. some input is registered at the same time an individual vibration is happening. This mostly results in the behavior of the slide down gesture that is done to refresh pages/apps.

I also cannot correlate neither the start of the phenomena nor its repetitions to anything in particular. I did neither drop my phone nor did I install a new app or changed any phone settings or installed an android update. Although the latter might have happened in the background without me noticing. The same goes for app updates.

What I've done so far:
deinstalled a multitude of apps
cleared the cache of other apps
disabled Haptic Feedback, Motion Sense and Active Edge in the phone settings

What I would like to avoid:
Reset the phone to factory presets because it's always a hassle to bring it up to a working state again
Sending the phone in for repair because i don't think that it's an hardware issue that is causing that behavior

So did anybody observe something similar recently? Or does have a clue on how to get rid of it?
(Or even just can point me to the place where I can look into something like an Android Event Log?)

Thanks in advance for your help!

PS: And yes, I'm aware that it might be a virus or something. But I'm pretty sure that I'm well set up with my ESET Internet Securiy for Android.
